text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Iraqi press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Russia hopes Iraq's oil deal with U.N. will lead to the lifting of overall trade curbs on Iraq.
- France welcomes Iraq's acceptance of all U.N. conditions for the partial flow of oil.
- Today the United Nations will ratify pricing formula for Iraq's limited oil exports.
- OPEC welcomes Iraq's latest deal with U.N. on oil.
- A Jordanian industrial delegation to visit Iraq.
- Baath party official discusses bilateral relations with Turkish officials in Ankara.
- Discovery of two oilfields in Tunis.
- Turkish source says Iraq's twin pipeline is ready for exports.
- Trade ministry ferries huge quantities of foodstuffs to local markets.
- Saudi Arabia is pleased with the timing of Iraq's agreement to U.N. conditions on partial oil exports.
- Gulf Airways suspends flights to Tehran.
- Kuwait welcomes Iraq's oil deal with U.N.
- The United States gives advance approval to Iraqi oil export pricing formula.
